We want to turn: (select (icmp eq (and X, C1), 0), Y, (BinOp Y, C2)) into: IF C2 u&gt;= C1 (BinOp Y, (shl (and X, C1), C3)) ELSE (BinOp Y, (lshr (and X, C1), C3)) iff: 0 on the RHS is the identity value (i.e add, xor, shl, etc...) C1 and C2 are both powers of 2 where: IF C2 u&gt;= C1 C3 = Log(C2) - Log(C1) ELSE C3 = Log(C1) - Log(C2) <a href="#ad51f65187d4c6b69d6bf8f71e027e4de">More...</a>

### foldSelectICmpAnd() {#afcb58333497c40468d7889705a5d0b03}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Value &#42; foldSelectICmpAnd (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectinst">SelectInst</a> &amp; Sel, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42; Cmp, InstCombiner::BuilderTy &amp; Builder)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This folds: select (icmp eq (and X, C1)), TC, FC iff C1 is a power 2 and the difference between TC and FC is a power-of-2.

To something like: (shr (and (X, C1)), (log2(C1) - log2(TC-FC))) + FC Or: (shl (and (X, C1)), (log2(TC-FC) - log2(C1))) + FC With some variations depending if FC is larger than TC, or the shift isn&#39;t needed, or the bit widths don&#39;t match.

Definition at line <a href="#l00122">122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/instcombine/instcombineselect-cpp">InstCombineSelect.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### foldSelectICmpAndAnd() {#a53cf44ef1c7130fc18add1138c045484}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Instruction &#42; foldSelectICmpAndAnd (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; SelType, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42; Cmp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; TVal, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; FVal, InstCombiner::BuilderTy &amp; Builder)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
We want to turn: (select (icmp eq (and X, Y), 0), (and (lshr X, Z), 1), 1) into: zext (icmp ne i32 (and X, (or Y, (shl 1, Z))), 0) Note: Z may be 0 if lshr is missing.

Worst-case scenario is that we will replace 5 instructions with 5 different instructions, but we got rid of select.

### foldSelectICmpAndBinOp() {#ad51f65187d4c6b69d6bf8f71e027e4de}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Value &#42; foldSelectICmpAndBinOp (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42; IC, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; TrueVal, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; FalseVal, InstCombiner::BuilderTy &amp; Builder)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
We want to turn: (select (icmp eq (and X, C1), 0), Y, (BinOp Y, C2)) into: IF C2 u&gt;= C1 (BinOp Y, (shl (and X, C1), C3)) ELSE (BinOp Y, (lshr (and X, C1), C3)) iff: 0 on the RHS is the identity value (i.e add, xor, shl, etc...) C1 and C2 are both powers of 2 where: IF C2 u&gt;= C1 C3 = Log(C2) - Log(C1) ELSE C3 = Log(C1) - Log(C2)

This transform handles cases where:
<ul>
<li>The icmp predicate is inverted</li>
<li>The select operands are reversed</li>
<li>The magnitude of C2 and C1 are flipped</li>
</ul>

</MemberDefinition>

We want to turn code that looks like this: C = or A, B D = select cond, C, A into: C = select cond, B, 0 D = or A, C.

<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The returned value of the cmpxchg instruction (%val) is the original value</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2948"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Match the following IR pattern:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2949"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   %x.lowbits = and i8 %x, %lowbitmask</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2954"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Define:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2955"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   %alignment = add i8 %lowbitmask, 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2956"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Iff 1 an %alignment is a power-of-two (aka, %lowbitmask is a low bit mask)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2957"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and 2 %bias is equal to either %lowbitmask or %alignment,</span></CodeLine>
